name: General Knowledge With a Fishy Theme Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: What kind of garment can be a kipper?
questions.explanation:
Tie.

	A kipper tie is a very wide tie, shaped like a kipper.

questions.text: Where might you wear a mullet?
questions.explanation:
Head.

	A 'mullet' is a name for a long-at-the-back, short-at-the-front man's hairstyle as worn by the British TV character Paul Calf. Not a good look!

questions.text: In which US state is Cape Cod?
questions.explanation:
Massachusetts & MA & Mass & Mass.

	Cape Cod is a famous protected coastline and holiday area.

questions.text: Michael Fish is a BBC TV presenter, in what field?
questions.explanation:
Weather.

	Michael Fish is one of the longest-serving BBC weather presenters. He famously denied that a hurricane was coming to England, hours before the 1987 hurricane hit.

questions.text: Which ER character has a fishy connection?
questions.explanation:
Dr Luka Kovac.

	Kovac is the name of a fish in Croatia, the name in English would be John Dory.

questions.text: Which TV series features a fishy law firm?
questions.explanation:
Ally McBeal.

	Ally McBeal's firm is called Cage and Fish, after the two founding partners John Cage and Richard Fish.

questions.text: Which actor played James Bond in 'Octopussy'?
questions.explanation:
Roger Moore.

	Roger Moore played Bond in this 1983 film, Octopussy herself was played by Maud Adams.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a fish?
questions.explanation:
Dill.

	Dill is a herb often served with fish. Goby, brisling and sild are all types of fish.

Schubert.

	Schubert originally wrote the main melody of the 'Trout quintet' as a song, which is perhaps why it is so memorable and tuneful.

questions.text: Which British actress, now in Hollywood, starred in the film 'Shooting Fish'?
questions.explanation:
Kate Beckinsale.

	Kate Beckinsale starred in this 1997 film. She went on to make 'The Golden Bowl' and 'Pearl Harbor'.
